transcript.text: What do you need to bear in mind when it comes to entertainment? Click on each heading to learn more.

contentText.text: Ask yourself the following questions before offering or accepting entertainment or hospitality:

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

tab.tabName: Does it serve a business purpose?

tabText.text: Meals and entertainment must be offered in the context of a business discussion. The primary purpose of the meal or entertainment should be business-related.
Please note that special rules apply to government officials, which will be discussed later in this training.

tab.tabName: Might it be offensive or inappropriate?

tabText.text: Don’t attend a venue or participate in any type of entertainment that is offensive or culturally inappropriate.

Adult entertainment that is sexually explicit in nature, even when potentially culturally acceptable or considered a normal business practice for a local or regional company, is not acceptable at Johnson Controls.
Remember, you are representing Johnson Controls at business entertainment events and engaging in inappropriate activities would reflect poorly on you and on the company.

Entertainment of your customer's or business associate's spouse or guest is not allowed unless pre-approved by local management. All approved spousal or guest entertainment must be specifically disclosed in expense reporting.
All costs, participants and the nature of the event must be accurately reflected in your expense reports.
Where possible, Johnson Controls employees should pay for third-party entertainment directly to the goods or services provider using a company credit card.

For work related business entertainment involving a group of Johnson Controls’ employees, the most senior level employee at the meal/ entertainment event should be the one who pays for and expenses the cost of the event.
Receipts are required for reimbursement. These should accurately reflect the entertainment provided and should be correctly recorded in your expense report.
